14
15#include <config.h>
16
17#include <sys/types.h>
18#include <sys/stat.h>
19
20#include <errno.h>
21#include <stdbool.h>
22
23#include "errno2result.h"
24
25/*! \file
26 * \brief
27 * The OS-independent part of the API is in lib/isc.
28 */
29#include "../fsaccess.c"
30
31isc_result_t
32isc_fsaccess_set(const char *path, isc_fsaccess_t access) {
33 struct stat statb;
34 mode_t mode;
35 bool is_dir = false;
36 isc_fsaccess_t bits;
37 isc_result_t result;
38
39 if (stat(path, &statb) != 0)
40 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
41
42 if ((statb.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0)
43 is_dir = true;
44 else if ((statb.st_mode & S_IFREG) == 0)
45 return (ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
46
47 result = check_bad_bits(access, is_dir);
48 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
49 return (result);
50
51 /*
52 * Done with checking bad bits. Set mode_t.
53 */
54 mode = 0;
55
56#define SET_AND_CLEAR1(modebit) \
57 if ((access & bits) != 0) { \
58 mode |= modebit; \
59 access &= ~bits; \
60 }
61#define SET_AND_CLEAR(user, group, other) \
62 SET_AND_CLEAR1(user); \
63 bits <<= STEP; \
64 SET_AND_CLEAR1(group); \
65 bits <<= STEP; \
66 SET_AND_CLEAR1(other);
67
68 bits = ISC_FSACCESS_READ | ISC_FSACCESS_LISTDIRECTORY;
69
70 SET_AND_CLEAR(S_IRUSR, S_IRGRP, S_IROTH);
71
72 bits = ISC_FSACCESS_WRITE |
73 ISC_FSACCESS_CREATECHILD |
74 ISC_FSACCESS_DELETECHILD;
75
76 SET_AND_CLEAR(S_IWUSR, S_IWGRP, S_IWOTH);
77
78 bits = ISC_FSACCESS_EXECUTE |
79 ISC_FSACCESS_ACCESSCHILD;
80
81 SET_AND_CLEAR(S_IXUSR, S_IXGRP, S_IXOTH);
82
83 INSIST(access == 0);
84
85 if (chmod(path, mode) < 0)
86 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
87
88 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
89}
90
